thing-type.label: LZW36 Fan & Light Switch
thing-type.description: Fan &amp; Light Switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThere are two different wireless protocols that are used to make this fan & light switch - Z-Wave and RF.</p&gt <p&gtZ-Wave is what gives the switch remote (smart) control, whereas RF is what connects the switch to the module. In other words, your hub/gateway connects to your switch, where you can tell it to change the speed of the fan or the brightness of the lights. From there the switch sends an RF command to the module to physically make those commands happen at the fan itself.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtEnable the inclusion process on your Hub or Gateway. Hold down button A and press button B 3x quickly and your LED Bars will pulse blue signifying the switch is in inclusion mode. If successful, the switch LED Bars will flash Green and if unsuccessful, the LED Bars will flash Red.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPlace your hub or gateway into exclusion mode. Then: Hold button A + Press Button B 3x. If it is successful the LED will blink green.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Light Dimming Speed
parameter.description: Light Dimming Speed<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis changes the speed in which the attached light dims up or down. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Light Dimming Speed (From Switch)
parameter.description: Light Dimming Speed (From Switch)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis changes the speed in which the attached light dims up or down when controlled from the physical switch. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Light Ramp Rate
parameter.description: Light Ramp Rate<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis changes the speed in which the attached light turns on or off. For example, when a user sends the switch a basicSet(value: 0xFF) or basicSet(value: 0x00), this is the speed in which those actions take place. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Light Ramp Rate (From Switch)
parameter.description: Light Ramp Rate (From Switch)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis changes the speed in which the attached light turns on or off from the physical switch. For example, when a user presses the up or down button, this is the speed in which those actions take place. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Minimum Light Level
parameter.description: Minimum Light Level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe minimum level that the dimmer allows the bulb to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has an LED bulb that does not turn on or flickers at a lower level.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Maximum Light Level
parameter.description: Maximum Light Level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe maximum level that the dimmer allows the bulb to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has an LED bulb that reaches its maximum level before the dimmer value of 99.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Minimum Fan Level
parameter.description: Minimum Fan Level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe minimum level that the dimmer allows the fan to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has a fan that does not turn at a lower level.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Maximum Fan Level
parameter.description: Maximum Fan Level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe maximum level that the dimmer allows the fan to be dimmed to.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_2
parameter.label: 10: Auto Off Light Timer
parameter.description: Auto Off Light Timer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAutomatically turns the light switch off after this many seconds. When the switch is turned on a timer is started that is the duration of this setting. When the timer expires, the switch is turned off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Auto Off Fan Timer
parameter.description: Auto Off Fan Timer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAutomatically turns the fan switch off after this many seconds. When the switch is turned on a timer is started that is the duration of this setting. When the timer expires, the switch is turned off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: Default Light Level (Local)
parameter.description: Default Light Level (Local)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefault level for the dimmer when it is powered on from the local switch. A setting of 0 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Default Light Level (Z-Wave)
parameter.description: Default Light Level (Z-Wave)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefault level for the dimmer when it is powered on from a Z-Wave command. A setting of 0 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Default Fan Level (Local)
parameter.description: Default Fan Level (Local)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefault level for the fan dimmer when it is powered on from the local switch.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Default Fan Level (Z-Wave)
parameter.description: Default Fan Level (Z-Wave)

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: Light State After Power Restored
parameter.description: Light State After Power Restored<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe state the switch should return to once power is restored after power failure. 0 = off, 1-99 = level, 100=previous.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_17_1
parameter.label: 17: Fan State After Power Restored
parameter.description: Fan State After Power Restored<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe state the switch should return to once power is restored after power failure.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_18_2
parameter.label: 18: Light LED Indicator Color
parameter.description: Light LED Indicator Color<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis is the color of the Light LED strip represented as part of the HUE color wheel. Since the wheel has 360 values and this parameter only has 255, the following equation can be used to determine the color: value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_19_1
parameter.label: 19: Light LED Strip Intensity
parameter.description: Light LED Strip Intensity<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis is the intensity of the Light LED strip.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_2
parameter.label: 20: Fan LED Indicator Color
parameter.description: Fan LED Indicator Color<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis is the color of the Fan LED strip represented as part of the HUE color wheel. Since the wheel has 360 values and this parameter only has 255, the following equation can be used to determine the color: value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Fan LED Strip Intensity
parameter.description: Fan LED Strip Intensity<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis is the intensity of the Fan LED strip.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_1
parameter.label: 22: Light LED Strip Intensity (When OFF)
parameter.description: Light LED Strip Intensity (When OFF)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis is the intensity of the Light LED strip when the switch is off. This is useful for users to see the light switch location when the lights are off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_23_1
parameter.label: 23: Fan LED Strip Intensity (When OFF)
parameter.description: Fan LED Strip Intensity (When OFF)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis is the intensity of the Light LED strip when the switch is off. This is useful for users to see the light switch location when the lights are off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_4
parameter.label: 24: Light LED Strip Effect
parameter.description: Light LED Strip Effect<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtByte 4: Effect - 0 = Off, 1 = Solid, 2 = Slow Blink, 3 = Fast Blink, 4 = Chase, 5 = Pulse</p&gt <p&gtByte 3: Duration</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 to 60 = 1 to 60 seconds</li&gt <li&gt61 to 120 = 1 to 60 minutes</li&gt <li&gt121 - 254 = 1 - 134 hours</li&gt <li&gt255 = Indefinitely</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtByte 2: Intensity - 0 to 9. 0 = dim, 9 = bright</p&gt <p&gtByte 1: Color - 0 - 255. Hue color wheel. value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value</p&gt <p&gtCalculator available at: http://calculator.inovelli.com/</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 24: Light LED Strip Effect Color
parameter.description: Light LED Strip Effect Color<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtHue color wheel. value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_4_0000FF00
parameter.label: 24: Light LED Strip Effect Intensity
parameter.description: Light LED Strip Effect Intensity<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 = dim, 9 = bright</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_4_00FF0000
parameter.label: 24: Light LED Strip Effect Duration
parameter.description: Light LED Strip Effect Duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt1 to 60 = 1 to 60 seconds</li&gt <li&gt61 to 120 = 1 to 60 minutes</li&gt <li&gt121 to 254 = 1 to 134 hours</li&gt <li&gt255 = Indefinitely</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_4_07000000
parameter.label: 24: Light LED Strip Effect Type
parameter.description: Light LED Strip Effect Type<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 = Off, 1 = Solid, 2 = Slow Blink, 3 = Fast Blink, 4 = Chase, 5 = Pulse</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_4
parameter.label: 25: Fan LED Strip Effect
parameter.description: Fan LED Strip Effect<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtByte 4: Effect - 0 = Off, 1 = Solid, 2 = Slow Blink, 3 = Fast Blink, 4 = Chase, 5 = Pulse</p&gt <p&gtByte 3: Duration</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 to 60 = 1 to 60 seconds</li&gt <li&gt61 to 120 = 1 to 60 minutes</li&gt <li&gt121 - 254 = 1 - 134 hours</li&gt <li&gt255 = Indefinitely</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtByte 2: Intensity - 0 to 9. 0 = dim, 9 = bright</p&gt <p&gtByte 1: Color - 0 - 255. Hue color wheel. value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value</p&gt <p&gtCalculator available at: http://calculator.inovelli.com/</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 25: Fan LED Strip Effect Color
parameter.description: Fan LED Strip Effect Color<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtHue color wheel. value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_4_0000FF00
parameter.label: 25: Fan LED Strip Effect Intesity
parameter.description: Fan LED Strip Effect Intesity<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 = dim, 9 = bright</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_4_00FF0000
parameter.label: 25: Fan LED Strip Effect Duration
parameter.description: Fan LED Strip Effect Duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt1 to 60 = 1 to 60 seconds</li&gt <li&gt61 to 120 = 1 to 60 minutes</li&gt <li&gt121 to 254 = 1 to 134 hours</li&gt <li&gt255 = Indefinitely</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_4_07000000
parameter.label: 25: Fan LED Strip Effect Type
parameter.description: Fan LED Strip Effect Type<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 = Off, 1 = Solid, 2 = Slow Blink, 3 = Fast Blink, 4 = Chase, 5 = Pulse</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_26_1
parameter.label: 26: Light LED Strip Timeout
parameter.description: Light LED Strip Timeout<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen the LED strip is disabled (Light LED Strip Intensity is set to 0), this setting allows the LED strip to turn on temporarily while being adjusted.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_27_1
parameter.label: 27: Fan LED Strip Timeout
parameter.description: Fan LED Strip Timeout<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen the LED strip is disabled (Fan LED Strip Intensity is set to 0), this setting allows the LED strip to turn on temporarily while being adjusted.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_28_1
parameter.label: 28: Active Power Reports
parameter.description: Active Power Reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 = disabled.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_29_2
parameter.label: 29: Periodic Power & Energy Reports
parameter.description: Periodic Power &amp; Energy Reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTime period between consecutive power and energy reports being sent (in seconds). The timer is reset after each report is sent.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Energy Reports
parameter.description: Energy Reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe energy level change that will result in a new energy report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_31_1
parameter.label: 31: Local Protection Settings
parameter.description: Local Protection Settings<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable local protection on these buttons.</p&gt <p&gt0 = None, 1 = Light, 2 = Fan, 3 = Both</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtMembers of this group will receive unsolicited messages related to the status of the switch.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Basic Set Light
parameter.description: Basic Set Light<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSends On & Off commands to associated devices. (1. Single press UP button sends BasicSet (0xFF) and 2. Single press Down sends BasicSet (0x00)</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Switch MultiLevel Set Light
parameter.description: Switch MultiLevel Set Light<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt Sends set level commands to associated devices when switch is pressed. (1. Hold & Release Up or Down button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet which keeps associated devices in sync with this device. 2. Single press Up button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet(0xFF) and 3. Single press Down button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet(0x00</p&gt

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Switch MultiLevel Start/Stop Light
parameter.description: Switch_MultiLevel_Start/Stop_Light<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSends start / stop level change to associated devices.(1. Hold Up button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_START_LEVEL_CHANGE (Up) 2: Hold Down button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_START_LEVEL_CHANGE (Down) 3. Release Either button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_STOP_LEVEL_CHANGE</p&gt

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Basic Set Fan
parameter.description: Basic Set Fan<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSends On & Off commands to associated devices. (1. Single press UP button sends BasicSet (0xFF) and 2. Single press Down sends BasicSet (0x00)</p&gt

parameter.name: group_6
parameter.label: 6: Switch MultiLevel Set Fan
parameter.description: Switch MultiLevel Set Fan<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSends set level commands to associated devices when switch is pressed. (1. Hold & Release Up or Down button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet which keeps associated devices in sync with this device. 2. Single press Up button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet(0xFF) and 4. Single press Down button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet(0x00)</p&gt

parameter.name: group_7
parameter.label: 7: Switch MultiLevel Start/Stop Fan
parameter.description: Switch MultiLevel Start/Stop Fan<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt Sends start / stop level change to associated devices.(1. Hold Up button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_START_LEVEL_CHANGE (Up) 2: Hold Down button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_START_LEVEL_CHANGE (Down) 3. Release Either button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_STOP_LEVEL_CHANGE</p&gt
